stockmarket.model

Class GUIStateModel

  • java.lang.Object
    • mvp.core.AbstractPropertyModel
      • stockmarket.model.GUIStateModel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    @ThreadSafe
public class GUIStateModel
extends mvp.core.AbstractPropertyModel
    A JavaBean bound property model that defines the current state of the GUI of the StockMarket program.

    THREAD SAFETY: This class is completely thread safe. The only mutable field is an int, which cannot be affected by a reference leak.

    Version:
    2.0
    Author:
    craig
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      GUIStateModel()
      Creates a new instance of this bound property model.

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.Integer getComponentsEnabled()
      Returns the program state affecting which components are enabled/disabled.
      java.lang.Object[] getDialogDisplayed()
      Get the configuration information for the dialog that was most recently displayed.
      void setComponentsEnabled(java.lang.Integer componentsEnabled)
      Sets the components that are enabled in the GUI, based on what state the program is currently in.
      void setDialogDisplayed(java.lang.Integer dialogCode, java.lang.Object... dialogConfig)

    • Constructor Detail

      • GUIStateModel

        public GUIStateModel()
        Creates a new instance of this bound property model. Sets the GUI state to NO_PORTFOLIO_OPEN by default.

    • Method Detail

      • setComponentsEnabled

        public void setComponentsEnabled(java.lang.Integer componentsEnabled)
        Sets the components that are enabled in the GUI, based on what state the program is currently in.
        Parameters:
        componentsEnabled - the state all components should be in, affects whether they are enabled/disabled.

      • getComponentsEnabled

        public java.lang.Integer getComponentsEnabled()
        Returns the program state affecting which components are enabled/disabled.
        Returns:
        the state of which components are enabled/disabled.

      • setDialogDisplayed

        public void setDialogDisplayed(java.lang.Integer dialogCode,
                               java.lang.Object... dialogConfig)
        Set which dialog should be currently displayed. Note that this value does not need to be changed when it is no longer being displayed. Configuration information for the dialog is passed along as part of the parameter array.
        Parameters:
        dialogCode - the code for which dialog to display.
        dialogConfig - optional configuration information for displaying the dialog.

      • getDialogDisplayed

        public java.lang.Object[] getDialogDisplayed()
        Get the configuration information for the dialog that was most recently displayed. Because this value does not necessarily get cleared when the dialog is closed, the value returned can only be guaranteed to be the last one displayed.
        Returns:
        the configuration information for the dialog that was most recently displayed.
